hypothesis_content.title: ETH Gas Futures Launch Drives Short-Term Gas Price Volatility Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: The launch of ETHGas's blockspace futures market with $800M liquidity commitments will increase short-term realized volatility in ETH gas prices (as measured by the 7-day rolling standard deviation of average gas price in Gwei) by >25% within 10 trading days of the news date, creating mean-reversion opportunities in gas-sensitive altcoins.
hypothesis_content.rationale: New derivatives products typically increase short-term volatility as market discovers price. $800M liquidity commitments suggest significant institutional interest that will test gas price discovery mechanisms. Historical pattern: CME Bitcoin futures launch increased BTC volatility 30% in first two weeks.
entry_conditions: ETHGas futures market launch confirmed (news date = trigger)

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH gas volatility reaches 0.8 z-score (100% increase from entry) OR 5 trading days pass
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH gas volatility drops below 0.3 z-score (fails to react)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: ETH gas volatility remains flat or declines (<10% change) within 10 days of futures launch despite $800M liquidity commitments.
